content.question: The speaker’s series of exclamations in lines 31-33 (“Sweet . . . Pan”) interrupt the pace of the narrative in order to

choices.label: dramatize the overwhelming beauty that is revealed as Pan begins to play
mimic the short bursts of music that Pan brings forth from the reed
convey the anguished nature of the reed’s protests of its treatment by Pan
express the horror the speaker feels at witnessing Pan’s actions by the river

content.answer: dramatize the overwhelming beauty that is revealed as Pan begins to play

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain the function of a particular sequence of events in a plot.
